page.title: 18Oxenton Church
page.content: Oxenton Church is an almost unspoilt mediaeval church built in the 13th Century.It was restored in 1905.The Perpendicular tower is built into the church.The belfry had 3 bells but only 2 remain.Inside the church the walls are covered in old paintings which are rather faded.The font is at the west end with a lead lining and a modern heavy wooden lid.A font is a bowl which you can be christened in.To the north of the church lies a mortuary chapel where the Earl of Ellenborough is buried.It is a room with no door nor any windows.The altar is made of wood with large bulbous legs.It has faces of cherubs carved upon the sides.There is one stained glass window with the Earl of Ellenborough's coat of arms. There are two piscinas where the priest used to wash the holy chalice etc.
